dialogues.text: CORBETT (Cont'd) (smiles) Be rude to let that happen after you kept me from freezing back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne Marie tries to hide how tempted she is by Corbett's offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eric) He's right about the snow.  We're blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric sighs -- is she against him, too?  From outside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trappers are obviously much closer.  Eric signals to Corbett not to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Corbett face the window.  They don't notice as A Marie quietly shimmies outside through the narrow dumb waiter shaft to the back of the rental cabin.  Eric turns gasping as he realizes she's gone.  Corbett smiles sardonically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least your girl had the sense to jump ship.  Too bad she's the only one small enough to fit through that dumb waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the cover of the snowfall, Anne Marie circles aroun the outside edge of town toward Wilder's cabin.  She take some of her photo gear from the snowmobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unaware of Anne Marie's maneuver, the trappers wait for a response from Corbett.  None comes.  Viking Bob places a calming hand on LeMalle's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait, we don't know what this guy's up to.  Ben'll let us know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a camera bag slung over her shoulder, Anne Marie cli up the metal antenna tower behind Neff's house on the edg of town. She grits her teeth and fights back a wave of vertigo. The ground disappears from sight, hidden by the snow and fog. Fifty feet up, she attaches her infrared video camera to tower crossbars and, using a length of coaxial cable, hoo its RF output to the feedline of the community TV antenna

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric looks at his watch.  10:55 AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CRACKING twig behind the cabins gets the trappers' attention.  Clutching his rifle, LeMalle goes to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: WITH LEMALLE
dialogues.text: as he probes through the snow, listening.  He reaches the edge of the woods and, finding nothing, returns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne Marie crouches behind a tree, twenty feet behind LeMalle.  After a moment, she tiptoes back toward the ren cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Corbett turn as Anne Marie's camera bag suddenly drops from the dumb waiter shaft.  Anne Marie wriggles ba inside.  Before Eric can say anything, she puts her finge over his mouth.  She turns on the TV set and tunes it to channel 3.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: A fuzzy IMAGE comes into view.  It's Devil's Cauldron fro the vantage of Anne Marie's infrared video camera.  The falling snow shows up as a translucent yellow wash over t scene.  Buildings are distinguishable as bluish silhouett Heat-producing objects -- warm walls, chimney smoke, etc. are pink and red.  And there are three clearly-definable human figures standing near the Maqi.  The trappers.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Corbett is amazed.  Eric smiles at Anne Marie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your infrared camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Technology in the wilderness. Only problem is talking to you on your way to the landing strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an idea.  We'll have to work fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He digs through Anne Marie's bag of equipment and supplie then stops and looks up.  Outside, there is an OS SOUND t is felt before it is HEARD.  The cargo PLANE approaches i the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trappers look at each other as the SOUND of the plane grows louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's what they're waiting on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles tightly) They'll have to come right past us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric quietly pulls the door open.  Holding the pistol to Corbett's head, he pushes Corbett out in front of him. Anne Marie and Eric exchange a long look.  Fighting back tears, she reaches up and touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you ran off, I thought you'd keep going 'til you were back home in Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My home is here.  With you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.  Then he and Corbett are gone, lost from sight the snowfall.   After a beat, Anne Marie takes a deep bre and slinks away in the other direction, toward the dance hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trappers wait, twenty-five feet from Eric and Corbett The DRONE of the plane grows louder.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC AND CORBETT
dialogues.text: start toward the airstrip.  Corbett sees a patch of bare dirt and SCUFFS his feet in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trappers turn to the SOUND, heard under the RUMBLE of the still-distant plane.  Converging, they head in that direction.  Suddenly, Anne Marie's VOICE booms through th town:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over PA) They're moving toward you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric SHOOTS a couple times, then backtracks and pulls Corbett behind one of the rental cabins. Ducking the bullets, the trappers sprawl onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne Marie has turned on the rusty TV near the pulpit. While watching the infrared IMAGE of the action outside, holds the microphone wired to the old PA.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAPPERS
dialogues.text: Viking Bob gestures to Mitchell and LeMalle to separate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over PA) They're fanning out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry, LeMalle BLASTS his rifle in direction of her VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Viking Bob) Kenai's PA -- but how the fuck she seein' us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter.  We know where they're going.  C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stalking, anxious, LeMalle follows Viking Bob.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: splits off from them and looks for footprints in the snow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric pushes Corbett through a narrow pass between two buildings in the center of town.  He walks in Corbett's footprints.  Almost through to the other side, he suddenl stops.  Pulling Corbett with him, Eric walks backwards, still carefully placing each foot in an existing footprIN Corbett can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the TV screen, Anne Marie sees one of the red bl change direction and head toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic) One is moving back toward the cabins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's LeMalle.  He crosses to Kenai's generator.  With a well-placed rifle SHOT to its innards, he GRINDS it to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV PICTURE disappears as the power dies.  Anne Marie keys the PA microphone; it's dead, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Corbett emerge from between the buildings.  Eric backtracks toward the hot springs spa, now leaving an obvious trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Corbett go inside.  Eric pulls the door closed behind them, but leaves it ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRONE of the approaching plane is ever louder.  Kenai stands and pulls on a succession of sweaters.  Dixie look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl, it's crazy to go out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear someone in the spa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He straps on a holster under his sealskin coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big 4-prop plane is about to touch down on the far si of the snow-covered airstrip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne Marie zips up her parka and cautiously goes outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeMalle follows the footprints to the door Eric left ajar He peers inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's tomb-quiet except for water DRIPPING and pipes CREAKING.  LeMalle looks around.  The sound of a small DI against metal above him gets his attention. He sees a fleeting shadow cut across the catwalk above hi He finds a metal ladder, slings his rifle over his should and climbs up.  Hearing another SOUND on the far side of catwalk, he hurries across, holding onto the pipes for balance. LeMalle is directly above the huge central pool.  He duck to go under a long piece of twine running from the ceilin to a dark corner below.  Suddenly, the twine snaps tight, pulling open a heavy trap door on the ceiling.  The door swings down and knocks LeMalle off the catwalk.  With a yelp, he splashes into the water below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden in the shadows, Eric drops the end of the twine an rushes toward the front door with Corbett in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Corbett) That'll keep him out of the cold.

dialogues.speaker: LEMALLE
dialogues.text: climbs out of the central pool, soaked.   He pulls his we jacket off and furiously throws it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric leads Corbett around the back of the spa.  A GUNSHOT rings out nearby and a BULLET hits the wall above Eric's head.

dialogues.speaker: MITCHELL
dialogues.text: has seen their faint silhouettes through the snow.  He purposely SHOOTS over their heads so he doesn't hit Corbe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Corbett crouch down and double back.   They are once again swallowed up by the snowfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viking Bob follows their footprints in between the buildings.  He continues to a point where they converge t one set, then stop.  He smiles at the naivete of Eric's ploy.  Looking at the boardwalk railing above, he assumes Eric and Corbett have swung over it onto the iced-over boardwalk.  Pleased with his deduction, Viking Bob contin along the alley. SNAP!  Viking Bob lets out a horrible HOWL and falls on h back in the snow.  Biting into his right calf is a huge conibear leg trap.  In extreme pain, he struggles to leve it open with the barrel of his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corbett shoots Eric a dangerous look as Viking Bob's CRIE carry though the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing Viking Bob's cries, Mitchell backtracks and rushe to Viking Bob's aid.  Between them, they manage to yawn o the jaws of the trap and free Viking Bob's leg.  Viking B tries to walk but the leg won't support him -- the bone i broken.  Bitterly frustrated, he waves Mitchell on.  In agony, Viking Bob eases down in the snow.  He tears a str of lining from his coat and wraps his leg to stop the bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne Marie scurries by on her way to the airstrip. Suddenly, the hot springs door bursts open and LeMalle lunges at her.  Stripped of his wet clothes, he's wrapped

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: in blankets and furs, his feet protected by sacks lashed them.  His wet body and hair steams in the frigid air. Anne Marie lets out a startled cry and springs away from him.  She falls hard on her back, knocking her wind out. Scrambling for footing in the snow, LeMalle drops his rif He comes at her again.  Anne Marie moves away and pulls t .44 magnum out.  LeMalle stops and glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) Don't make me shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up, keeping the magnum pointed shakily toward hi LeMalle glowers menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We're going to Sam's cabin.  You can stay in the jail until this is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeMalle slowly crouches down for his rifle.  Anne Marie wields the handgun at him, but he doesn't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to chance it with that hog-leg?  You can't even hold it up.  Better drop me first shot, bitch, or I'll rip your fuckin' lungs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taunting, sneering, LeMalle stares her down.  Anne Marie paralyzed.  Feeling that he's won, LeMalle wraps his bony fingers around the stock of the Remington. Anne Marie closes her eyes and FIRES.  Pulling the rifle close, LeMalle tucks and rolls and jumps to his feet.  An Marie FIRES again, and AGAIN.  Shot, LeMalle hobbles away leaving a trail of blood in the snow.  Numb, Anne Marie l her arm fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric looks around at the sound of the shooting, fearing t worst.  He pulls Corbett off the boardwalk and they cut across open ground toward the airstrip depot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenai looks around at the messy RESULTS of LeMalle's ransacking for things to wear.  Kenai turns, startled, wh he hears footsteps.  It's Neff and Meyerling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Lookit this damn mess.  Where in hell's Wilder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Dead.  Trappers killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Jesus.  Told you this was trouble. (to Meyerling) What about you, big shot?  Do something.  Who's side are you on, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I thought you people loved Corbett and his wild men!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shoot-'em-up shit is bad for business.  I'm sick of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, Neff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... two of the trappers are down already --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly on the bandwagon) -- One left; three of us.  Let's finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Eric Desmond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll handle him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the snow, Eric can see the faint outline of the plane on the runway.  He and Corbett hurry toward the bac of the airstrip depot. As they wend their way through the junk-filled yards, Eri catches a glimpse of movement around a corner, REFLECTED a pane of glass leaning against a roll of tar paper.

dialogues.speaker: REFLECTION
dialogues.text: Peacemaker in hand, Mitchell is behind the depot, coming right for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric takes out the homemade flashbomb.  He lights it, tos it toward Mitchell and covers his eyes.  It EXPLODES with muffled pop and a bright flash of white light. Mitchell stumbles backwards and blinks his eyes.  The fla has temporarily clouded his vision. Eric moves Corbett to another approach to the depot and waits for Mitchell to move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell is about to do just that when a hand on his shoulder stops him.  It's LeMalle, oblivious to the profu bleeding from his right shoulder.  Mitchell blinks, still having trouble seeing.  LeMalle gestures for him to be qu and points in Eric and Corbett's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Over there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hoists his Remington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Hold it.  You might hit Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.  I hit what I'm aiming at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let 'em come closer first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But LeMalle is too anxious.  He swings the rifle up, left-handed, and SHOOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet just misses Eric.  He panics and wildly return FIRE with the .357.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell and LeMalle scatter under the hail of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC AND CORBETT
dialogues.text: as they HEAR LeMalle's labored footsteps run past them, nearby.  Eric peers cautiously around the corner toward t depot.  There is no further movement. Eric waits a moment, then leads Corbett cautiously toward the depot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the rear wall, they practically stumble over something.  It's Mitchell, lying on the ground near the wall, badly wounded by Eric's barrage.  Eric gasps. Anguished, Corbett kneels next to Mitchell.  Mitchell pul him closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to see you're okay.  I told LeMalle not to shoot. (tries to smile) Had some fine seasons, didn't we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell's grasp on Corbett's coat relaxes as he dies. Horrified, Eric stares at the man he killed.  Noticing th scrimshaw lying on the snow where it slipped from Mitchel pocket, Corbett picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eric) Fifteen years on the trail with this man, I never saw him rise to anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glaring at Eric, Corbett dips his hand in Mitchell's bloo and suddenly smears it across Eric's mouth.  Repelled, Er pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; bitterly) Your first kill.  How does it taste?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wiping his face, sickened and desolate, Eric has no reply

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, from somewhere close by, LeMalle FIRES at them.  Er stuffs the .357 in his belt and uses a brick to knock the padlock off the back door of the depot.  He pushes Corbet inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pony-tailed, ex-hippie PILOT shuts his engines off an removes his Walkman headphones.  Hearing LeMalle's continuing GUNSHOTS, the Pilot pulls his door closed and turns on his two-way radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio mic) Circle, this is BMY-955.  I just touched down in Devil's Cauldron. Nobody's here to greet me like usual, and there's gunfire.  I'm getting scarce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, he STARTS his engines up again.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO ERIC IN DEPOT
dialogues.text: who turns, startled, when he hears the ENGINES coughing t life OS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot fiddles with his controls and prepares to take off.  He looks up, surprised, as the passenger door sudde opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne Marie slides onto the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my responsibility to get this aircraft out of here safely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne Marie points the .44 at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You got to be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the engines idling.  Go back and open the side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking his head and muttering, the Pilot unfastens his s belt, climbs between the two seats to the cargo compartme and obliges the little lady with the big gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The depot, as temporary-looking as the rest of Devil's Cauldron, is a boxcar-shaped loading dock and warehouse w a corrugated steel roof.  Boxes, wood palettes and hand dollies are piled haphazardly about. Eric and Corbett navigate through the piles of boxes, inching toward the front door -- the door leading to the plane. Suddenly, a string of overhead lights come on.  Eric goes for the .357, then stops when he sees Meyerling, Kenai an Neff have come in the front door.  Kenai stomps his feet shivers.  Grandstanding for the others, Meyerling steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody wants any more killings; we all agree to that, correct? (no one argues) That's good.  Now, Eric, you're gonna hand your prisoner over to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't your concern.  It's over, here and now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Meyerling) Sure, when you put a bullet in my back on the way out.  Easier for all involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad idea.  Face it, Ben. There's no room in Alaska for you any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meyerling pokes with his foot at a tipped-over rack of Eskimo paraphernalia -- masks, furs, big skin drums, fish and bear-spears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You're as antiquated as this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meyerling moves toward Corbett, but Eric stands in his wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're quite a piece of work, Meyerling.  The tide changes, you ride right along with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric looks at Neff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neff, you know better than this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an outsider, Mr. Desmond. Step aside; stay out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenai and Neff move in with Meyerling.  Eric stands his ground and reaches for the .357 in his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, LeMalle stumbles into the depot, the blankets a furs dragging at his feet.  His right side is bathed in blood.  Half-frozen, bled dry, he looks ready to drop dow dead.  In his left hand, impossibly, he still clutches th massive Remington. He hoists it to his hip and grits his teeth as he BOLTS a round into the chamber with his injured right arm.  Braci himself, he levels the rifle at Eric. Hearing the ACTION of the rifle, Eric turns. Corbett reaches down, grabs a rusty Eskimo spear in both handcuffed hands, and hurls it. There is a deafening ROAR as LeMalle's rifle discharges. LeMalle flies back from the recoil -- and from the spear stuck clear through his chest. Some packing material above Eric's head smolders, ignited the muzzle blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a moment of silence.  Corbett looks at the other weapons near him, and then at Meyerling.  Threatened, Meyerling pulls out a .380 automatic.  Before Eric can do anything, Meyerling FIRES. The IMPACT of the bullet throws Corbett against some boxe

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With a YELL, Eric jumps Meyerling and rips the gun from h grasp.  Enraged, he pummels Meyerling with it until Kenai and Neff pull them apart.  Eric wrenches away from them a scrambles to his feet with Meyerling's gun in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Anybody moves and I'll shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the .380 on them, Eric crosses to Corbett.  Bleed from the abdomen, he's trying to stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Can you walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wound's a through-and-through. Missed my liver, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautiously backing away from the others, Eric helps Corbe get up and shuffle toward the OS SOUND of the cargo plane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne Marie jumps down from the cockpit.  She and Eric lif Corbett into the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it taxis and lifts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Eric takes Corbett's handcuffs off, Anne Marie look at his wound.  He waves her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you didn't let him shoot me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Like I said, I'd still be up on that mountain, frozen solid, it wasn't for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get you to a hospital, soon as we get to Fairbanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they can patch me up and put me in a cage?  Forget it. Meyerling's right -- I'm a dinosaur.  Greedy bastards like him, it's their turn with this land.  Put me in the woods, let me live or die on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He painfully pulls himself into a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; peers out window) Look down there, tell me what any of this matters.  Struggles of men get swallowed by the bigness. Soon there won't be a trace of our troubles... or us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong.  Everything we do leaves its mark.  You said it yourself -- there are hundred- year-old footprints in the tundra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too tired to argue, Corbett leans back against the window He takes Mitchell's scrimshaw out of his pocket and looks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exquisitely beautiful and detailed engraving depicts grizzly beside a wilderness creek, with trees and mountai in the background.

dialogues.speaker: CORBETT
dialogues.text: clutches the scrimshaw in his hand and closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric sighs as he looks at the blood -- Mitchell's blood - on the back of his hand.  He stares at Corbett for a long moment.  Then, resolved, he climbs up front and says something to the Pilot.  Grumbling, the Pilot adjusts his controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow clouds are dissipating.  The cargo plane comes d through them and lands on the airstrip behind the pumping station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it rolls to a stop, Eric throws open the cargo door. Corbett sits up, surprised.  He and Eric exchange a long look, then Corbett crosses to the open door and gingerly steps down onto the snow-covered runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Anne Marie watch from the door of the plane as Corbett limps across the runway toward the treeline.  As goes, his footprints are dusted over by the snow and wind Corbett stops, turns and looks back at Eric, then continu onward, disappearing into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: CARGO PLANE
dialogues.text: Eric closes the cargo door as the Pilot turns the plane around and taxis back down the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric wearily sits next to Anne Marie.  She kisses him. The Pilot glances over his shoulder and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Too damn crazy in this state anymore.  I'm moving back to L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane climbs above the fog and snow clouds into a sun ice blue sky.  It banks and turns south.  Behind it, the mountains roll on toward the Arctic wasteland, forever.
